description: From discovery to real-world impact, VDEC equips scientists with the expertise and facilities to navigate each step in the development of vaccines and therapeutics.

details.body:
The Vaccine Development and Evaluation Centre (VDEC) supports scientists at every stage of the vaccine and therapeutic medicine development process.

The stages of vaccine development are:

  1. Discovery and surveillance

  2. Antimicrobial resistance (AMR)

  3. Pre-clinical

  4. Clinical

  5. Post-licensure

Discovery and surveillance

We provide cutting-edge resources and expertise to help researchers unlock the secrets of viruses and bacteria. Our state-of-the-art laboratories and experienced team assist with techniques like viral isolation and characterisation. These enable scientists to pinpoint vulnerabilities that a vaccine can exploit.

See more information on VDEC’s discovery and surveillance services

Antimicrobial resistance (AMR)

VDEC responds strategically to AMR pathogens and new emerging threats (fungi, viruses, and bacteria), by determining the most appropriate research goals to combat these pathogens.

See more information on VDEC’s antimicrobial resistance (AMR) services

Pre-clinical

Before a vaccine candidate can be tested in humans, it needs to prove its potential in a safe and controlled environment. This is the pre-clinical stage.

At the pre-clinical stage, VDEC provides:

  • a wide range of animal models, from small rodents to non-human primates
  • expertise in designing and conducting pre-clinical trials
  • the ability to handle pathogens at the appropriate level of containment
  • the development of assays with a smooth transition to the clinical testing phase

See more information on VDEC’s pre-clinical services

Clinical

Clinical trials test how well new vaccines and therapeutics work in humans. VDEC acts as a trusted partner throughout this critical phase.

Our team possesses extensive experience in designing and conducting analyses that support clinical trials. We:

  • guide researchers through complex regulations
  • ensure work adheres to the highest ethical and scientific standards
  • provide state-of-the-art facilities for conducting work on materials from trials
  • provide access to advanced monitoring and evaluation tools

See more information on VDEC’s clinical services

Post-licensure

The post-licensure phase ensures the vaccine continues to be safe and effective in the real world.

Robust surveillance systems track vaccine safety and effectiveness after widespread use. We collaborate with public health agencies that monitor for any adverse events and analyse long-term data. This vigilance allows for continuous evaluation and potential adjustments to optimise the vaccine’s impact.

UKHSA also provides vaccine education. We work with healthcare professionals and the public to address vaccine hesitancy and promote informed decisions.

VDEC does not just help develop vaccines; we help them thrive in the real world.

See more information on VDEC’s post-licensure services

Work with VDEC

We work with industry, academia and government. Contact UKHSA today to see how we can help you.

Get in touch

Or send an email to vdec@ukhsa.gov.uk
